args:
When reinforcements are delayed, Joachim is
forced to change tacticsâ€”but sadly it comes to
little avail. He then recalls Kirsty's words and
decides to trust Noelle, taking Chelle's loaned
manacaster in hand as he makes a final stand.
Report, sir! The enemy's breached the\nsecond defensive line and a squad is\nmarching on our location now!
Their overwhelming numbers are not\ndoing us any favors...
We just need to hold until Noelle returns\nwith reinforcements. We can do this.
Noelle heads to the Halidom for backup,\nwhile we keep the enemy's eyes on us and\ntry to thin their numbers the best we can.
Still, I can't say I'm a fan. Using one of\nour own as a decoy just doesn't feel right.
Heh. Another letter delivered. Let's see...
ï¼‚I'll be back with reinforcements as quickly\nas I can. You can trust me, so PLEASE\ndon't do anything crazy.ï¼‚
Don't worry, I'm no fan of overachieving.
But I'm even less a fan of not doing what I\ncan and regretting it later.
*nod* I, um...don't want to regret anything\neither. So leave the reinforcements to me!
Level with me, {player_name}:\nYou think Noelle's up to the task?
Didn't you assign her the task because\nyou thought she could do it?
If I'm brutally honest, there's not a lot in\nher combat record that screams ï¼‚trust me\nwith your lives, it's fine.ï¼‚
I paired her up with one of our soldiers\njust to be safe, but he's almost as green\nas she is.
I'm wondering if it isn't time to face facts\nand start planning for the worst.
Build a strategy around the assumption\nthat no help is coming, you mean?
If they were coming, they'd have been here\nby now...and I'm not seeing anybody.
I don't want to needlessly burn through our\ntroops waiting for help that never shows.\n...So? What do you think?
This may sound harsh, but I'm not the one\nin command here. That choice is yours.
Taking a page right out of Kirsty's book,\nhuh. But hey, I respect that.
In that case, we'll focus our forces on a\nsingle point and strike at the commander.
Still no sign of the enemy commander,\nsir! We believe they may have already\nfallen back to their operating base.
Seems our opponents predicted we would\ntry to finish this quickly.
They have an absolute numbers advantage,\nso they can just wait for us to bleed out.\nTypical Barthe cowardice right there.
It may not be chivalrous, but it's effective.\nOur troops are exhausted, and morale is\nslipping by the hour.
Do you really intend to keep advancing\nin pursuit of their leader, Joachim?
It's the only shot we have at overcoming\nthe gulf in manpower.
And if Noelle returns with reinforcements?\nThat'll change our whole outlook.
You still believe in her, huh?

Oh, I want toâ€”but this isn't a situation
belief alone will solve. I mean, look at the
facts on the ground here and tell me what
I'm supposed to believe in.
I'd tell you to believe in Noelle's word.\nShe told us to count on her,\nand I think we should do it.
*nod* I, um...don't want to regret anything\neither. So leave the reinforcements to me!
Noelle isn't quick, and her stamina's\nnothing to write home about. Hell,\nshe's a messenger who can't even TALK.
But Kirsty and Victor see something in her.
...I care more about your diligence and\nsincerity than I do about your past\naccomplishments...
Okay, yeah. I get it now.
When Noelle says something, you can feel\nthis...intensity. A kind of resolve, I guessâ€”\neven though she can barely get a word out.
Just as record of success can earn trust,\nso can a person's expectations fuel faith.\nI get it now.
Everybody, pull back! We're going to duck\nand move as best we can to preserve our\nstrength until backup arrives!
I'll serve as rear guard. Can I ask you to\ntake vanguard, {player_name}?
No objections here, but are you certain?\nYou're as exhausted from battle as anyone.
Just means I get an opportunity to put\nyour sister's little gift to use.
We only have to hold on a little bit longer.
